line.en: 'I've opened my eyes.'
I close my eyes and roll over in bed, and it\ndoesn't feel like my sleepiness is coming back.
I sit up and open the curtains.
The sky is dark. I can see the stars twinkling.
I went to take a look outside, but no one was\nthere.
It's Amane's turn this morning.
'Where is Amane?'
Maybe she went back to her room.
I take a look around but it looks like she's not\nthere.
'Whew...'
I started to feel sleepy again.
'Maybe I should go back to my room and sleep.'
I said to myself as I headed to the gate.
There, in the middle of the runway, I could see\nAmane standing there, absentmindedly.
'Amane.'
'Hmm? Oh, Aoi.'
'What are you doing out here?'
'Hmm? I was looking at the sky. The view from\nhere is really good.'
says Amane as she looks to the sky.
I copy her and look up at the sky too.
The whole sky above us is filled with stars.
'...It doesn't look like it will appear today.'
'...You're right.'
The sky is calm, and the stars aren't being\nblocked by clouds, and countless lights are\nshining down on the earth from above.
It's just before dawn, and it looks like the\nweather conditions needed to create the gigantic\npassage of clouds will not be occurring.
'We just have to wait for tomorrow.'
'Yeah.'
Amane replied while looking up at the sky. As I\nlook at her, she seems kind of sad.
'It's OK. It'll come. I'm sure of it.'
I say that despite having no reason to believe\nso, and Amane gives me a sideways look.
'Why do you think that?'
'I don't know if it'll come or not. But if we\ndon't think it's coming, then we won't be able to\ndo anything, will we?'
'I guess not.'
'So, I think the best thing to do is to assume it\nwill occur and act based on that.'
It will be a real shame if it doesn't come.
'We can't wait here for the rest of our lives,\ncan we?'
We have a time limit.
That time limit is until Amane has to quit.
'...I've been waiting this whole time.'
Amane speaks as she looks towards the distant\nsky.
'And now, I've reached the last year that I can\nwait.'
'But, in this final year, you and the others have\nbeen here.'
'Also, we've made the preparations to fly, at\nlong last.'
'That's why, I especially want the Morning Glory\nto appear this year.'
'Are you really gonna leave...?'
I can no longer stop myself from asking, and\nAmane gives a little smile.
'That's what I promised.'
Amane's leaving.
The sadness makes me feel painful inside, just\nfrom imagining it.
'I wanted to spend more time with you, Amane. In\nthat garage.'
'Ha ha... me too. This summer has been so much\nfun.'
Amane giggles as she recalls it.
'Thanks to all of you, I'll have so many\nwonderful memories.'
'Let's make lots more. Even after the summer\nholiday is over.'
'Ha ha ha, that would be great, but I can't. It\nseems I've enjoyed the student lifestyle for much\nlonger than other people normally do.'
'So, after you quit, you won't be coming back to\nthe school...?'
Amane didn't say anything, she just quietly\nlooked to the sky.
'Now that I think about, there are still many\nthings I have left to do as a student.'
'I've been a student for almost twice as long as\neveryone else, but I feel like I've only enjoyed\nit half as much.'
'...I wish I'd met you sooner.'
'I wanted to have been able to have spent more\ntime as just a regular student with you.'
Amane smiles kindly and the tension seems to fade\nfrom her expression.
I am a little startled to see her smile like\nthat.
'Me too. Every day would definitely have been\nfun. If Isuka and Tatsuya were there too,'
then the days that we've spent together this\nsummer would've continued every day for five\nyears, no doubt about it.

'...Could I really think about it in that way?
The summer that I spent with you guys, was like
all the fun of student life squeezed into one
season.'
The way she speaks makes it sound like it's over\nalready.
That makes me feel both sad and frustrated.
'The summer's not over yet. Aren't there still\nthings you want to do?'
If there are, I want to help her fulfill them.
'Hmm... that's right. To fly through the Morning\nGlory, I guess.'
'That will... come true.'
There's no guarantee that the Morning Glory will\noccur in the few days we have left.
But when I thought of all the years that Amane\nhad been waiting, I lied to myself and thought\nthat it must happen.
'And there's that other thing...'
'What's that?'
'Love.'
'Love...?'
Amane nods.
'I've never experienced romantic love before. If\nI were a normal student, I would've experienced\nit already, wouldn't I?'
'Well... perhaps.'
If you include unrequited love, that would\ninclude most people.
'Is there someone you like?'
'Hmm... I'm not sure. I don't really understand\nit myself.'
'Isuka said that love is a wonderful thing.'
'To love is to make the world sparkle, for a\nmoment.'
'Unfortunately, I've never experienced that. I\nstill don't understand what Isuka meant.'
'What do you think, Aoi?'
'I don't know... I've never experienced the world\nsparkling all of sudden.'
I feel that what Isuka said is kind of\nexaggerating.
'So, have you kissed anyone...?'
asked Amane as she looked me straight in the\neyes.
Naturally, the stars in the sky reflected in our\neyes, and we stared into each other's sparkling\neyes.
I should be able to answer her easily, but I find\nmyself unable to.
Amane's eyes, and also Amane herself, are just\ntoo beautiful, and I just look at her without\nsaying anything.
'Aoi?'
'N... no, I haven't.'
'...Is that so? I thought that you would have.'
'I think that if I had a chance, I'd like to try\nit.'
I said it quite casually, but I start totally\nfreaking out when I realize 'What am I saying!?'.
It definitely sounds like I'm implying 'I wanna\nkiss you, Amane!'.
'Hmm.'
Amane nods meaningfully.
'So, why don't you try it with me?'
'Oh, that's no good, is it? Your first kiss\nshould be something special.'
'I'm sorry, I can't do that to you, Aoi.'
'No, that's not the case.'
I spoke again without thinking, so I started to\npanic again.
Amane looks at me like she's thinking about\nsomething.
'So, would it be OK if I asked you to...'
Amane blushes a little as she speaks.
'Is it OK for you to do that with me...?'
'This is the final memory of my student life. I\nwouldn't just choose anyone.'
'I want it to be you.'
Amane looks quite shy and embarrassed about it,\nand even though she's much older than me, she\nseems really adorable.
'(Amane's so cute when she's embarrassed...)'
Looking at me vacantly, Amane comes closer, step\nby step.
She raised her chin, closed her eyes, and her\nlips protruded upwards ever so slightly.
She stands still, waiting.
I hesitate for a moment, then put my hands on her\nshoulders.
Then, I bring my face closer to hers...
'I... I can't do it!'
Surprised, Amane opens her eyes all of a sudden.
I push her away by the shoulders.
'It's no good, Amane!'
'Why not?'
'You should do this with someone that you really\nlike!'
Amane stares at me while I speak.
Then, pouting, she mumbles...
'That's why I asked you to do it, Aoi.'
'Ah... well... that's not what I meant by\n'like'...'
I makes these kinds of flustered excuses, and\nAmane turns around.
'...You've really hurt my feelings.'
'I'm sorry...'
'Whatever. I'm going back.'
She spoke in an unusually sulky tone, then\nstarted walking briskly.
'Ah... wait, Amane!'
'Hmph!'
I call to try and stop her, but she ignores me as\nshe walks quickly across the runway, and I run\nafter her.
Then, I realized that the eastern sky was\nbeginning to glow.
